snippet: Lino Brocka’s “Manila in the Claws of Light,” at the Museum of Modern Art, is a 1975 movie about the limits to life in the Philippines under the dictator Ferdinand E. Marcos.
abstract: Manhola Dargis reviews movie Manila in the Claws of Light by Filipino director Lino Brocka.
lead_paragraph: Lino Brocka’s “Manila in the Claws of Light,” at the Museum of Modern Art, is a 1975 movie about the limits to life in the Philippines under the dictator Ferdinand E. Marcos.

headline.print_headline: Small Dreams Set Afire on Marcos-Era Streets
headline.seo: Lino Brocka’s ‘Manila in the Claws of Light’
headline.main: Small Dreams Set Afire on Marcos-Era Streets
headline.kicker: Movie Review | 'Manila in the Claws of Light'
